comments:
Using 3.2M4.
I received the following IAE after selecting the package explorer tab immediately after (during) startup.  The only other information I noted at the time was that there was a message indicating that the hierarchy view was being refreshed or reinitialized (or something to that effect) at the time I clickd on the package explorer view.

!MESSAGE Unable to create view ID org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer: Argument cannot be null
!STACK 0

Could be that 'Argument cannot be null' is wrong (see bug 90464). There is already a null check that tree doesn't get a null argument. So maybe the parent is disposed.

Moving to jface.
Susan, I'm re-assigning based on Martin's comment. Feel freet to punt back if this isn't JFace.
marking for 3.2 so this gets looked into during the 3.2 cycle

on second thought, this should probably be assigned to the JFace Viewers component.  I think it's a life cycle issue with a workbench restart...an editor is being activated before the package explorer is recreated.  So the real problem may be higher up the food chain, but since the stack is in the viewer world, assigning there first.
Please reopen if you see this again. We don't have enough information to fix this.
